html:
5.27.21  11:49 pm   Listened to "got some money" on JBL studio monitors w/ the matching subwoofer and wow the clarity on the high and low end is ear candy. How do you approach separation btwn kick drum and bass gtr? Do you mix with speakers, headphones, or both? 

      in my opinion, the key to this game is not putting any reverb on the bass or kick. that may be a no brainer but it's worth mentioning

5.27.21  10:03 pm   Gustav Mahler once said, "A symphony must be like the world. It must contain everything." Do you have this sort of attitude toward your songs? Do you agree with it?

      it's good to leave at least some things out. if you include everything it will probably just seem like 1 solid blank sheet, because it will all cancel each other out

5.27.21  9:06 pm   In Movie Star, what time signature do you see the main chorus and verse sections to be in? Or if not applicable, what groupings of beats did you intend during the writing process?

      the chorus is a repeating 9 beat pattern, which i prefer to think of as 4/4 + 5/4. the verse also starts this way, but soon deviates from it

5.27.21  7:18 pm   what is the song of your meanings?

      i'm trying to make as many as i can

5.27.21  6:37 pm   Whats the real name of Steve from "hi, im Steve"?

      your name

5.27.21  1:33 pm   do you feel pressured to make music based on what your fans expect from you?

      no

5.27.21  1:28 pm   What's the key to saucy chords? You seem to have the hang of it

      it all comes down to saucy situations

5.27.21  1:27 pm   Did you watch Charles Cornell's video about some of Money?

     yes

      If not, why not, and do you ever watch videos analyzing your music? If you did watch his video, 1) do you appreciate it?

     yes

     and 2) how correct is he with blocking out the right chords and musical ideas?

     usually about 65%

5.27.21  1:03 pm   Where are the 3d parts in got some money?

      the "in the streets" part, there is a water clip somewhere around "billion", then "don't understand...", and several other scenes soon after that

5.27.21  12:56 pm   If you had to pick one, what's your favorite song that you've made?

      it should always be the one i'm currently working on

5.27.21  11:34 am   Why did you make Got Some Money?

      to accompany the "money" song

5.27.21  7:46 am   What kind and/or how much vocal training have you had?

      never understood most vocal training, because i found breathing to be so connected to thought, i've always found it difficult to really control your breathing/air directly. so vocal triaining mostly never made sense to me in that way. so i was stuck on my own, and yet i sounded terrible. so that left me to figure out what to do. i quickly realized that there is a phenomenon at play here which is very similar to acting. you have to convince your inner-most mind to actually believe in the things you are communicating. A neat hack i found was to improvise the lyrics. i always seemed to sound much better when the words were genuinely made up at the time i'm singing them, instead of scripted. and if they are scripted, you have to ask a lot of similar questions that an actor would ask, about your character and your situation that you are trying to envoke. but aside from that, i also found out later that simply the more time singing makes you better. then much later on, a voice doctor told me that clearing your throat is bad, so i stopped doing that, and i also picked up a boring warm up exercise which i do on morning walks

5.27.21  7:45 am   can you make a song about infinity

      that must be a common topic of my songs

5.27.21  7:15 am   will you put an f chord for the next song or perhaps a variation of an f chord? (F7, FM etc) 

      the song is in F and has a lot of Fs. there is also Fmaj7 in there somewhere

5.27.21  5:55 am   5.26.21  2:47 pm

Yes thanks. To be more specific, it's right after you sing  'astray' and right before you sing 'buckets'.

      Asus4 will do you just fine there. if you are able to tenderly lace a 2 note in there (B) also, you can get away with it, but i'd recommend just Asus4 to most strongly and clearly get the right effect here

5.27.21  5:21 am   Will there be music in your next song? 

      let me perform some calculations

5.27.21  3:39 am   How did you discover YouTube

      a friend told me about it in 2006

5.27.21  12:34 am   why don't you use capital letters?

      i do, but, why don't you

5.26.21  11:58 pm   do you like traveling?

      yes

5.26.21  10:48 pm   Is the moon really made out of cheese?

      no

5.26.21  10:44 pm   do you like tritone subsitutions

      occasionally

5.26.21  10:32 pm   Given how you've expressed interest in motion capture and how recent Pro-series iPhones and iPads have LIDAR, are you interested in getting one to do some motion capture in your music videos?

      not yet

5.26.21  10:20 pm   what do your songs mean

      they are music. and according to my calculations, music means anything and everything

5.26.21  9:45 pm   Is "Outside" about starting a new life?

      it's about going outside

5.26.21  8:39 pm   i'm tryna figure out the key of 'im a princess' so i can play it on the guitar. could you give me some pointers?

      it's in the key of D, although it doesn't use any D chord until the chorus

5.26.21  8:17 pm   Whats the bpm of Here comes the sun

      130

5.26.21  7:36 pm   what new song will you write to be your favorite?

      a different one each time

5.26.21  5:17 pm   hi. i'm starting my first job soon as a cashier. do you have any advice at all? 

      not yet. nothing has happened yet. so far everything is fine. let me know how it goes and if you encounter any problems

5.26.21  5:06 pm   how do you decide on what you call your songs/videos? for example, what were you debating about when you were trying to decide the title of "got some money"?

      it was written in my song list as "got some money, got some cash, i'm rich and now i'm sad", but that's obviously too much for a real title. more reasonable titles would be "got some money, got some cash", then i quickly settled on "money (cash)" and i assumed that is what it would be for most of the time i was writing it. Then i decided to go even simpler for the song title ('money') because it seemed the strongest. And for the video i didn't want anyone to think it was going to be just a video about money, so i made a slight tweak to make the video title look even more like a song title

5.26.21  4:56 pm   which artists inspire you 

      potentially you

5.26.21  4:55 pm   will you re-attempt the two-week schedule?

      yes

5.26.21  3:57 pm   how to be motivated?

      what would you like to do

5.26.21  2:49 pm   what won't your next song be about?

      money

5.26.21  2:47 pm   In 'I'm a princess' I keep hearing an A chord in the verse but it's not just any A chord. It sounds likes it consist of these notes: A B C# D E. Correct me if I'm wrong but what chord is that?

      sometimes it's A, sometimes it's Asus4, surely a lot of times it's Asus4(with 2). this should explain all 5 notes you mentioned, but probably not all 5 at the exact same time

5.26.21  1:44 pm   what are the chords in the 'see sea saa aaa' part?

      Gsus2/C    Dadd4    Esus4/G#    F/Bb

5.26.21  1:36 pm   what was the bad thing that you did in "I just did a bad thing"? 

      tried to order a 10-pack of something, but actually ordered a 10-pack of 10-packs

5.26.21  12:47 pm   I'm wondering, have you ever had problems with changing the first supertemporary sketches (like temp perc/rhythm tracks) because you didn't redo them early enough, and now those first drafts (if played well) feel like an integral part of the composition that you can't really change?

If so, how have you solved this? I have some ideas, but would like more input.

      i guess it depends if you like it. if you like it, you can keep it. if you don't like it, you can change it

5.26.21  12:32 pm   how can i get original ideas for my paintings if i want to make others understand that painting?

      you can't make anyone understand something. But, the good news is, people tend to understand just about anything. a pretty good rule to go by: if you understand it, people will understand it. this is assuming of course that you are a people

5.26.21  11:12 am   why do you sometimes include strange verses at the end of some songs, like the "just got home, got no home" part in La de da de da de da de day oh, or in Just did a bad thing with "just did a strange thing now everything's pink"??

      through years of experimentation, i just find often that's the best way to end a song

5.26.21  10:22 am   could you please explain chords for me? I keep reading questions about them, and I have no clue what they mean

      it's when you have multiple different pitches playing at the same time. you'd have to try it, there's no way i could explain how this sounds. when you hear it you should start tripping balls. it's that cool

5.26.21  9:52 am   How do you write such interesting melodies without relying on a lot of music theory?

      how can the ocean not rely on boats

5.26.21  9:41 am   what's the actual meaning of 'I am a princess'

      being a song, there's really no limit to its meaning

5.26.21  8:23 am   is your next song about songs?

      not quite

5.26.21  7:35 am   hi! i'm planning on starting a band, but i need a little help. what are the necessary parts of a band? i know drums and bass are probably really important, along with a chordal instrument. is this true? am i missing anything?

     sounds like you need a melody in there somewhere. voice? Also it's totally possible to skip the bass and drums, and just go for some percussion, choral instrument (who also has to take care of the bass as well) and voice. but don't take my word for it, just try some things and see if it sucks

5.26.21  6:40 am   will you make an album?

      i'm not sure why that's better than songs, BUT, i will make songs. And for something more substantial, i will make videos with adventurous tales and stories in them

5.26.21  3:52 am   i think what most people wants to hear about when they yell at you about the capital letter issue is the answer to the question that why are you not using them at the beginning at the sentences as the common rule suggests. in formal letters or formal digital letters it still feels necessary to do that, at least for me, but at any other kinds of letters, it feels unnecessary to me.

     i agree

     do you have any other relatively unpopular customization rules for your grammar? 

     it's not unpopular to skip first-letter capitalization of sentences. it's normal. First letter capitalization is good too, sometimes as a formality. Formality is also popular in some circles.

5.26.21  3:23 am   what is a bass section of a song?

     would be a part of songs that has ... mostly only bass? not every song has this necessarily. in fact most songs probably don't

      I thought it was the part of the instrumentation that's lower in pitch,

     yes you are right about that

      but I'm starting to doubt this for some reason.

5.26.21  3:00 am   if you were to do a concert, which instrument would you use while singing?

     voice/vocal

      or would you just sing without using instruments and let a band do all the music?

     it's hard to explain what i would do. that's because i still want to do more trillions of things than there is ever time for in a human lifetime

5.26.21  1:16 am   do you find it annoying when people assume there's a grand underlying message behind all of your songs?

      no, do you

5.25.21  11:55 pm   How do I stop comparing myself with other people, artistically or otherwise

      sounds like it's time for you to go on holiday with yourself
